column4: look at /etc/event.d/tty*  Check the upstart notification to see how to properly stop those from getting executed
(I don't know if there is a cleaner way than just removing them)
just delete the tty's i dont want running?

probably best to back them up somewhere.  If you look inside, you can probably just comment the line that tells it to run on runlevel 2.  Again, I'm not really familiar with upstart, so at least glance through their docs
